prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
Powers is the actor who plays the character Steel Samurai. The witness Oldbag is describing what she saw at the guard station.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] [caption] Steel Samurai is seen walking. He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the murder, I arrived at the guard station at 1:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 1
Testimony: Poor old Hammer and the rest had been doing a run-through there since the morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 2
Testimony: I, well, I had some errands to run that morning.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, it was 1:00 when I got to the guard station.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 4
Testimony: I was at the main gate from then until 5:00!
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 5
Testimony: Now, the murder happened at 2:30 PM, right?
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 6
Testimony: Interesting to me, because a certain man walked right by me at 2:00 PM.
Person: Oldbag
Testimony 7
Testimony: It was Powers! That man right there, and he was heading toward the studio!
Person: Oldbag

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.

response:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So, the question is asking which evidence and testimony contradict each other. We have to look through the provided context, characters, evidences, and testimonies to find a pair where the evidence directly contradicts a testimony.

First, let's look at the testimonies from Oldbag. She has four statements:

0. The time of death was 2:30 PM (which matches the autopsy report, so no issue there).
1. The only person she saw going to the studio before then was Will Powers.
2. No one else went there.
3. If they had, she would have seen them.

So, her main point is that Powers was the only one who went to the studio before the murder, and she would have seen anyone else. Now, looking at the evidences, we need to find something that shows someone else was there despite her claim.

Evidence 5 is Powers'(?) Photo taken at the gate at 2:00 PM showing the Steel Samurai dragging one leg. The caption mentions the Steel Samurai, which is Will Powers' character. But wait, the autopsy says the time of death is 2:30 PM. So Powers was seen at 2:00 PM, which is before the murder. Oldbag says she saw Powers going there, which matches. But maybe there's another angle here.

Wait, maybe the problem is with the Steel Samurai costume. If someone else was wearing it, then even though Oldbag saw the Steel Samurai (assuming it's Powers), it could be someone else. But the evidence here is a photo of the Steel Samurai. Let me check other evidences.

Evidence 11 is Mr. Monkey's Head, which blocked the path from 2:15 PM to 4:00 PM. If the path was blocked, how did the killer get in? But Oldbag's testimony is about seeing people go to the studio. The path being blocked might mean that after 2:15 PM, no one could get through, but the murder happened at 2:30 PM. If the path was blocked, the killer must have been already there. But how does that contradict Oldbag's testimony?

Wait, Oldbag's testimony says she saw Powers going before the murder (before 2:30 PM). If the path was blocked at 2:15 PM, then anyone entering after that couldn't get through. But the photo of the Steel Samurai was taken at 2:00 PM, so that's before the path was blocked. Maybe someone else was already inside before the path was blocked, but Oldbag claims she didn't see anyone else. 

Another angle: The Steel Samurai in the photo is dragging one leg. Maybe that's a clue. If the real Powers doesn't drag his leg, but the person in the photo does, it could be someone else in the costume. For example, the victim, Jack Hammer, played the Evil Magistrate. But he was killed by the spear. Alternatively, maybe the director or someone else. If the photo shows someone else in the costume, then Oldbag's testimony that only Powers went there is contradicted because she saw the Steel Samurai (which she assumes is Powers) but it's actually someone else. But how does the evidence directly contradict?

Alternatively, maybe there's another evidence that shows someone else was there. Let's look at Evidence 18, the van used by Manella to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting. If they went to the studio, but Oldbag didn't see them, that's a contradiction. But when did they go? The time of death is 2:30 PM. If they went after the meeting, which was maybe before 2:30 PM, but Oldbag claims she saw only Powers. So if Vasquez and Manella went to Studio One via the van, but Oldbag didn't see them, that would contradict her testimony. But the van is Evidence 18. The testimony is 3 where she says if anyone else went, she would have seen them. So if the van was used to go to Studio One without passing the security camera, maybe they took a different route. But does the guidemap (Evidence 2) show that there's another path? The security camera is at the path to the studio, but maybe the van took a different route. But the problem is whether the van's use contradicts Oldbag's testimony.

Alternatively, the photo in Evidence 5 might show the Steel Samurai (Powers) at 2:00 PM, but then the path was blocked at 2:15 PM. The murder happened at 2:30 PM. So if the path was blocked, the killer couldn't have left after the murder, but that's not directly contradicting Oldbag's testimony.

Wait, another approach: Oldbag's testimony 3 says if anyone else went, she would have seen them. But Evidence 11 (Mr. Monkey's Head) blocked the path between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. So if someone went to the studio after 2:15 PM, they couldn't because the path was blocked. But the murder was at 2:30 PM, so the killer must have been there before 2:15 PM. However, Oldbag says she only saw Powers before then. So if someone else was already there before 2:15 PM, but Oldbag didn't see them, that would contradict her. But how?

Wait, the security camera takes a photo whenever someone walks by. So if someone went to the studio before 2:15 PM, they would have triggered the camera. Oldbag claims she saw only Powers. But maybe the photo in Evidence 5 shows the Steel Samurai at 2:00 PM, but another photo (if any) shows someone else. However, there's no other photo mentioned except Evidence 5. Alternatively, maybe Cody's camera (Evidence 15) has a photo taken at a different time. But Cody's camera is a digital camera he's learning to use, but there's no specific time mentioned for his photos. The key here is that the path was blocked after 2:15 PM, so the killer had to be there before that. But Oldbag claims she saw only Powers. So the contradiction would be if someone else was there before 2:15 PM but wasn't detected by the camera. But according to the security camera's setup, that's impossible unless they didn't pass by the camera. But the path to the studio has the camera. So unless there's another way in, but the guidemap might show that. If the guidemap (Evidence 2) indicates an alternative route that bypasses the camera, then someone could have gone without being seen, contradicting Oldbag's testimony that she would have seen them. So Evidence 2 (guidemap) showing an alternate path would contradict Testimony 3 (if they had gone, she would have seen them). That could be a possible pair. Let me check the evidence details. Evidence 2 is the guidemap, and if it details that there's another path that doesn't go by the security camera, then someone could have used that path without being detected, thus contradicting Oldbag's testimony that she would have seen anyone else. So the contradiction would be between the guidemap (Evidence 2) and Oldbag's Testimony 3. Because the guidemap might show an alternate route, meaning someone could have gone without her seeing, hence her Testimony 3 ("If they had, I would have seen them") is contradicted by the existence of another path. Therefore, the pair would be evidence 2 and testimony 3.
